meanings.def: a meeting at which something, especially a new product or idea, or piece of work, is shown to a group of people
examples: presentation on/about somebody/something The sales manager will give a presentation on the new products.
Several speakers will be making short presentations.
The conference will begin with a keynote presentation by a leading industry figure.

meanings.def: the act of showing something or of giving something to somebody
examples: The trial was adjourned following the presentation of new evidence to the court.
The presentation of prizes began after the speeches.
The Mayor will make the presentation (= hand over the gift) herself.
on presentation of something Members will be admitted on presentation of a membership card.
a presentation copy (= a free book given by the author or publisher)

meanings.def: the way in which something is offered, shown, explained, etc. to others
examples: Improving the product's presentation (= the way it is wrapped, advertised, etc.) should increase sales.
I admire the clear, logical presentation of her arguments.
The main emphasis of the training will be on presentation skills.

meanings.def: the series of computer slides (= images) that are shown with the talk when somebody gives a presentation at a meeting
examples: I've put my presentation on a memory stick.

meanings.def: a ceremony or formal occasion during which a gift or prize is given
a performance of a play, etc. in a theatre
the position in which a baby is lying in the mother’s body just before birth
